iati-activity.description: Increase possibilities for the Deaf to participate actively to society and for independent living.

iati-activity.title: Frame agreement with NGO (Fida Int.)
iati-activity.description: Youth Centres in Mitrovica and Vushtrri. The project seeks to address the needs of the youth in Mitrovica and Vushtrri through empowering a local partner for effective youth work. For the past 15 years the educational opportunities for the youth of Kosovo have been very scarce; first due to Yugoslavian government regulations and then due to the prolonged political conflict. Now, without sufficient education, a whole generation of youth has lost their hope for future. Fida partners with the Protestant Evangelical Church to improve the situation. The project started in 2000 with one youth centre in the city of Mitrovica and soon another centre was established in Vushtrri. The youth centres offer a wide variety of activities and training for up to 2000 youth annually, e.g. English classes, computer training and sports events. Through organizing the activities, the local partner gets hands-on training in youth work. Through the work done at the centres, the skills of the local partner in youth work will increase. The centres provide the youth with meaningful leisure time activities and training in various subjects that play an important role when continuing to further education. As a consequence the overall life management skills of the youth will improve.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Assistance to sustainable development in Dragash
iati-activity.description: Dragash municipality which borders with Macedonia and Albania has around 40 000 inhabitants. The Sunique harrprodimi alpine range is situated in Dragash. Dragash is one of the poorest municipalities in Kosovo and suffers from out-migration. UNDP proposed for financing a project for sustainable ecological and economic development for Dragash, including establishmen of the Sharrprodimi Stewardship Authority and a community-based development plan. The project proposal includes also creation of a Local Development Agency and 5 pilot projects. The unit for EU enlargement and Western Balkans is ready to finance the 18 months' preparatory phase of the project with a budget of 756 000 euros. The financing of the implementation phase is also in the plans of the unit. The appraisal will be conducted in the end of the preparatory phase.

iati-activity.title: INGO Aid to decentralisation process through ECMI
iati-activity.description: In order to support stability and sustainable development Kosovo is implementating the Ahtisaari Comprehensive Proposal for the Kosovo Status Settlement. The provisions of the proposal include multi-ethnic society, protection and promotion of the rights of members of communities and decentralisation. According to the proposal some municipality boundaries will be changed and new municipalities established. International non-governmental organisation European Centre for Minority Issues (ECMI) requests Finnish support for a decentralisation project. The project is built for support to new and existing multi-ethnic communities during the decentralisation process. ECMI stresses the importance of participation of the local level and minorities in the decentralisation process, and also the importance of tranparency and accountability of the decision-making in the municipalities.

iati-activity.description: European Union Rule of Law Mission in Kosovo.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: Debates on reproductive health care in Kosovo. The NGO Media Centre (a Kosovo Serb NGO based in one of the main enclaves in the Central-Kosovo) during six months (Aug 2009-Feb 2010) will organize six public debates on these topics: women health in Kosovo, prenatal and postnatal care of the women, use of contraception in Kosovo, sexual education with youth, habits and myths within societies in maternal health, access to medication and HIV virus presence in Kosovo. These debates are followed by Albanian, Serbian and other media and the highlights will be distributed through TV and print media.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Forest Sector Support in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: Finland supports forest sector reform in Kosovo. The project supports the implementation of the Kosovo national forest strategy (2010). In addition, it supports integrated forest management and practices and climate change mitigation. The intervention supports the decentralization process and promotes participation of local communities in municipalities, especially in rural areas.

iati-activity.title: Development of Special Needs Education
iati-activity.description: Support is given for the development of Special Needs Education in Kosovo by providing technical assistance.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: The duration of PVPT program is 16 July 2009 â 31 December 2010, divided into two phases 1st phase 16 July-31 Dec 2009, and this 2nd phase 1 Jan-31 Dec 2010 The objectives are: 1.To provide rehabilitation program for up to 45 referred local and foreign VoTs and pVoTs (minors and adults) as well as to 22 low risk trafficked persons, 2: To enable a minimum of 50% of the referred beneficiaries to develop basic vocational skills during their stay at the Rehabilitation Center. 3: To raise awareness for up to 80% of the victims of trafficking who participate in the project on human trafficking and human rights. 4: To increase knowledge among beneficiaries about legal proceedings in Kosovo and ways to cooperate with law enforcements through provision of legal aid and counseling. 5: To empower and make aware the victims of trafficking on gender issues and job opportunities.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: Handikos supports children and adults with dissabilities for their rights and needs toward integration and full participation in the society. Their activities consist of: Service provision for children with disabilities (Primary physical rehabilitation and psycho social activities), Identification and registration of people with disabilities, Supporting people with disabilities with orthopaedic equipment and other sanitary materials, Advocacy and lobbying for the rights of people with disabilities, Pre-education of the children with disabilities, Advising parents of children with disabilities, Raising awearness of the society for the rights of people with disabilities, Supporting women with disabilities, Increasing capacities of the CBR staff.
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: Skopje Summer School is a component of Mitrovica Rock School that consists of two branches; in the North for the Serbs and in the South for the Albanians. Summer School takes place in Skopje, Macedonia, where 24 youth and 10 teachers play and rehearse together for a week preparing for the closing outdoor concert. The goal of the project is interethnic cooperation and reconcilliation between ethnic groups. Implemented by Community Building Mitrovica (CBM).
iati-activity.sector: Basic life skills for youth and adults

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: Radio KIM will provide media coverage for functioning and work of the newly established Serbian municipalities in Kosovo through decentralization process: Gracanica, Strpce, Klokot/Vrbovac, Ranilug, and Partes, but also forthcoming Novo Brdo and North Mitrovica through special radio shows, along with written presentation of these news and materials on radio stations' website www.radiokim.net. 26 programs, each 60 minutes,during 01 October 2010 â 31 March 2011

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: Main objective of the project is raising of public awareness of Kosovo people on the key processes related to the Kosovo-Serbia talks. This is done by organizing 6 public debates during 6 months in a Media Centre: what the technical negotiations are about; after the first Kosovo-Serbia meeting participants from both sides will be invited to present details of the meeting, what will these talks bring to the people of Kosovo, status of the North Kosovo, analytical views on final results of the talks etc. Debates will be held in Serbian which is a minority language in Kosovo. Translation to Albanian and English will be provided. The project will make use radio, tv and print media.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: The goal is to ensure free and fair elections in Kosova. DIA will try to utilize earned media opportunities to send out the message. Using media conferences and other media opportunity is part of the communication strategy. TV commercials, leaflets, posters and newspaper advertisement will be used as part of the GOTV component. TV and Radio commercial will be used as part of the increase profile campaign.

iati-activity.title: Local Cooperation Fund (LCF) in Kosovo
iati-activity.description: Developing strategy for RAE Womenâs Network empowerment KGSC in cooperation with RAE Womenâs Network and in consultation with UNIFEM will organize a one-day conference. The conference aim is to present the research (mapping) report and to invite all stakeholders and donors both local and regional who are involved in this sector to present their strategies and policies towards supporting RAE women community in Kosovo.
